External_Reference.reference_text: Nickling, W.G., and M. Ecclestone, (1981), The effects of soluble salts on the threshold shear velocity of fine sand, Sedimentology, 28(4):505-510.

Instrument.name: Guelph Wind Tunnel at Wind Erosion Laboratory, Department of Geography, University of Guelph, Ontario, Canada
Instrument.description: The Guelph Wind Tunnel is a research facility located at the Wind Erosion Laboratory within the Department of Geography at the University of Guelph, Ontario, Canada. Its purpose is for studying wind erosion, sediment transport, and atmospheric boundary layer processes.
